item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Zygmunt Bauman
item.description: "One thing which even the most seasoned and discerning masters of the art of choice do not and cannot choose, is the society to be born into - and so we are all in travel, whether we like it or not. We have not been asked about our feelings anyway. Thrown into a vast open sea with no navigation charts and all the marker buoys sunk and barely visible, we have only two choices left: we may rejoice in the breath-taking vistas of new discoveries - or we may tremble out of fear of drowning. One option not really realistic is to claim sanctuary in a safe harbour; one could bet that what seems to be a tranquil haven today will be soon modernized, and a theme park, amusement promenade or crowded marina will replace the sedate boat sheds. The third option not thus being available, which of the two other options will be chosen or become the lot of the sailor depends in no small measure on the ship's quality and the navigation skills of the sailors. Not all ships are seaworthy, however. And so the larger the expanse of free sailing, the more the sailor's fate tends to be polarized and the deeper the chasm between the poles. A pleasurable adventure for the well-equipped yacht may prove a dangerous trap for a tattered dinghy. In the last account, the difference between the two is that between life and death." -- Zygmunt Bauman

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by رضا قاسمی / Reza Ghasemi
item.description: "وقتی زبان مادری‌ات فقط 127 فعل داشته باشد که مستقیم صرف می‌شوند، وقتی هزاران فعل دیگر را باید به کمک فعل معین صرف کرد، و این فعل هم درست همان فعلی باشد که برای عمل هم‌خوابگی به‌کار می‌رود، آن‌وقت زبان خیانتکار می‌شود." -- رضا قاسمی / Reza Ghasemi

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by رضا قاسمی / Reza Ghasemi
item.description: "می گویند فراموشی دفاع طبیعی ِ بدن است در برابر رنج . دردی که نوزاد هنگام عبور از آن دریچه‌ی تنگ ، متحمل می‌شود چنان شدید است که کودک ترجیح می‌دهد رنج زاده شده را برای همیشه از یاد ببرد ..." -- رضا قاسمی / Reza Ghasemi

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by رضا قاسمی / Reza Ghasemi
item.description: "منظره‌ی ویرانی آدم‌ها غم‌انگیزترین منظره‌ی دنیاست ." -- رضا قاسمی / Reza Ghasemi

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by شهریار مندنی پور / Shahriar Mandanipoor
item.description: "حالی داشتم مثل مستی در اندوه که می نوشی و می فهمی زیادی است و باز سر می کشی تا استفراغ" -- شهریار مندنی پور / Shahriar Mandanipoor

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by شهریار مندنی پور / Shahriar Mandanipoor
item.description: "تب انگار مخمل است به تن آدم، آرام می کند دل و مغز را. حالا دیگر تنها نیستم. توی تنم غریبه هایی هستند که به تبم انداخته اند. حرفی را نزده، اینها می دانند، چون توی خونم هستند، می دانند. اینها هم گرچه آزار می دهند، ولی با این تب آرامش هم می دهند، که جدایم می کند از همه و همه جا" -- شهریار مندنی پور / Shahriar Mandanipoor

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by شهریار مندنی پور
item.description: "خوشا به حال آنها که رها نشده اند از ازل که بیهوده بپویند راه ابد را که سرانجام به ازل می رسد از دوران جهان و خوشا به حال مردگان آخرین که اندوهی به ارث نمی گذارند.دل دلدادگی" -- شهریار مندنی پور

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart. The really great men must, I think, have great sadness on earth." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by نجيب سرور
item.description: "إنني لستُ مجنونًا إلى الحد الذي أقبل فيه أن أكون مجنونًا" -- نجيب سرور

item.title: kheyzaran add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "As a small child, I felt in my heart two contradictory feelings, the horror of life and the ecstasy of life." -- Charles Baudelaire
